class_notes:
Medieval architecture with its luminous windows, soaring vaults and flying buttresses is instantly recognizable. These forms constitute a revolution in aesthetics and technology from the buildings of the ancient world. How did this change come about? And what impact did the new demands of the Christian liturgy as well as other medieval religious traditions including Byzantine Christianity and Islam play? 
Art History major/minor: Division II
Architectural Studies minor: elective
course_description: Medieval architecture revolutionized the building techniques and aesthetic principles employed in the ancient world. These spaces served new practices, worshipers and pilgrims. This course examines how and why these soaring cathedrals, Byzantine churches and Islamic mosques came about.
